name: prefer
content:
prefer verb [T]
(CHOOSE)
Add to word list
Add to word list
A2 to like, choose, or want one thing rather than another: Do you prefer hot or cold weather? I prefer red wine to white. [ + -ing verb ] He prefers watching football to playing it. [ + to infinitive ] I'd prefer not to discuss this issue.formal I'd prefer you not to smoke (= I would like it better if you did not smoke), please.
More examplesFewer examplesSome people prefer a vegetarian diet, while others prefer a meat-based diet.I'd prefer not to work but I don't have much choice.Most convalescents prefer to be cared for at home rather than in a hospital.You can detach the hood if you prefer the coat without it.Would you prefer to pay by cash, cheque, or credit card?
